Auckland teen’s heartbreak over pack-rape sentences, says system is ‘messed up’ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-teens-heartbreak-over-pack-rape-sentences-says-system-is-messed-up/7RUIW3HFMRBJZIW24EXH4UCDAY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-teens-heartbreak-over-pack-rape-sentences-says-system-is-messed-up/7RUIW3HFMRBJZIW24EXH4UCDAY/ Tara ShaskeyThree men raped her. She was in pain, felt powerless, 'frozen' and too afraid to resist. Sat, 18 Jan 2025 22:15:53 +0000 A teen girl, pictured on the left, was pack-raped in July 2022. The court case was recently closed with the sentencing of two of the offenders involved, Teina Takimoana, centre, and Arthur Te Wera, right.

Generation Beta: What’s the future in health, tech, education and climate change for our newest Kiwis? https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ Generation-beta-whats-the-future-in-health-tech-education-climate-change-for-our-newest-kiwis/IGN7OBESQBF5DPTFNFF5QXLBLQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ Generation-beta-whats-the-future-in-health-tech-education-climate-change-for-our-newest-kiwis/IGN7OBESQBF5DPTFNFF5QXLBLQ/ Cherie HowieObesity could end, and increased diversity may topple 'anti' politics in a Gen Beta world. Sat, 18 Jan 2025 16:00:00 +0000 Harrison Alexander Cheng is among the first members of the new Generation Beta, those born between 2025-39. Harrison was the first baby born at Auckland City Hospital this year, arriving at 12.07am on January 1. Photo / Alex Burton
Ōkahu Bay cannon theft: Inside the police files as person-of-interest in audacious heist speaks out https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/okahu-bay-cannon-theft-inside-the-police-files-as-person-of-interest-in-audacious-heist-speaks-out/D4V6ZANLXFCYFBT7US3JHPKYB4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/okahu-bay-cannon-theft-inside-the-police-files-as-person-of-interest-in-audacious-heist-speaks-out/D4V6ZANLXFCYFBT7US3JHPKYB4/ George BlockIs the old cannon in a storage locker somewhere, or did it disappear into the Far North? Sat, 18 Jan 2025 16:00:00 +0000 The two-century old Russian cannon was stolen early one morning last June. It has not been seen since. This photo was attached to the police file obtained by the Herald under the Official Information Act.
